reportSummary.summary: The Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek Watershed Plan details a comprehensive strategy to address nutrient, sediment, and pathogen impairments through the implementation of BMPs, targeted outreach, and ongoing monitoring. Covering 35,085 acres in Tate County, Mississippi, this plan sets reduction goals for organic enrichment, nutrients, and fecal coliform, coordinates federal and state partners, and provides a timeline and measurable benchmarks to guide water quality restoration efforts.
reportSummary.planTitle: Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek Watershed Plan GY 2017
organizations: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tate County Soil and Water Conservation District

goals.description: Achieve the modeled nonpoint source (NPS) loads in the TMDL for nutrients by implementing conservation practices that target both TN, TP, and sediment reduction.
goals.schedule: During the project implementation period, through BMP installation.
goals.sourceExcerpt: In order to achieve the modeled NPS loads in the TMDL, nutrient BMPs will be implemented watershed. This will be done by implementing in-field conservation practices that target both TN, TP and sediment reduction as soils in MS are known to have high phosphorus content.

goals.description: Reduce fecal coliform loading by 50% in Hickahala Creek and by 70% in James Wolf Creek within the watershed.
goals.schedule: During the project implementation period, in accordance with the 2003 TMDL.
goals.sourceExcerpt: The Fecal Coliform TMDL for Hickahala Creek is calling for a 50% reduction in the section of Hickahala Creek that is located within the Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek Watershed. The same TMDL also calls for a 70% reduction in James Wolf Creek.

bmps.name: Fencing
bmps.description: Install 10,000 feet of fencing to restrict livestock access to streams, limiting pathogen and nutrient input.

bmps.name: Tank/Trough (Watering Facility)
bmps.description: Provide 3 livestock watering facilities to support exclusion of animals from streams.

bmps.name: Ponds
bmps.description: Construct 4 ponds as alternative water sources for livestock participation in exclusion efforts.

bmps.name: Streambank and Shoreline Protection
bmps.description: Install 500 feet of streambank and shoreline protection to reduce erosion and sediment input.
bmps.sourceExcerpt: Streambank and Shoreline Protection 500 ft @ $161.00 ft 80,500 54,167

bmps.name: Grade Stabilization Structures
bmps.description: Construct grade stabilization structures on 8 acres to reduce gully and surface erosion.

bmps.name: Heavy Use Area Protection
bmps.description: Protect 1,240 feet of heavy use areas (livestock or equipment) by hardening surfaces.

implementation.description: Coordinate with partners to determine priority areas contributing significant pollutant loads to the watershed.

responsibleParties.name: Tate County Soil and Water District

implementation.sourceExcerpt: Coordinate with the MDEQ, NRCS, MSWCC, USGS, and the Tate Co. Soil and Water District to determine priority areas that are contributing significant pollutant loads to Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek watershed

implementation.description: Establish Watershed Implementation Team (WIT) for plan refinement and oversight.

responsibleParties.name: Tate County Soil and Water District

implementation.sourceExcerpt: Establish Watershed Implementation Team to begin refinement of Watershed Based Plan for Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek watershed

implementation.description: Initiate monitoring for baseline conditions using historical and new data.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Initiate watershed monitoring Baseline condition monitoring Completed using historical data

implementation.description: Meet with landowners/cooperators to secure commitments for BMP installation.

responsibleParties.name: Tate County Soil and Water Conservation District

implementation.sourceExcerpt: Meet with landowners and cooperators to secure commitments to install BMPs in priority areas

implementation.description: Establish routine meeting schedule for WIT to support plan revision.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Establish routine meeting schedule for WIT to support WBP revision

implementation.description: Implement BMPs in priority areas per plan and TMDL recommendations.
Inspect BMPs installed using Section 319 funds to ensure proper construction and maintenance.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Coordinate with Landowners to inspect BMPs that were installed using Section 319 funds

implementation.description: Begin post-BMP monitoring to assess water quality improvements.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Begin monitoring to collect data on post-BMP water quality

implementation.description: Finalize education and outreach plan and hold events.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Finalize education and outreach plan Education/Outreach events scheduled

implementation.description: Finalize the revised Watershed Based Plan.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Finalize revised WBP Final Revised WBP

monitoring.method: In situ and laboratory sample; Mississippi SOPs
monitoring.frequency: Pre- and post-BMP monthly/seasonal as per project QAPP
monitoring.sourceExcerpt: The following thresholds will be used... Dissolved Oxygen Daily Average of 5.0 mg/L; ... Dissolved Oxygen % Sat ≥ 70% - ≤ 125%
Total Nitrogen 0.940-1.110 mg/L (threshold range based on healthy biologically attaining streams in West Bioregion)
Total Phosphorus 0.080-0.120 mg/L (threshold range based on healthy biologically attaining streams in West Bioregion)

thresholds.description: 30-day geometric mean of 126 per 100 ml; ≤410 per 100 ml no more than 10%

monitoring.sourceExcerpt: E. coli 30-day geometric mean of 126 per 100 ml; samples during 30-day period should not exceed 410 per 100 ml more than 10% of the time

monitoring.method: Mississippi Benthic Index of Stream Quality (M-BISQ)
monitoring.frequency: Pre- and post-BMP (one or more years post-implementation)
monitoring.sourceExcerpt: Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek is in the West bioregion and the attainment threshold is 43.7. Along with overall MBISQ scores, the in-stream habitat surveys will also be used to determine change over time.

outreach.description: Educational programs and literature targeted to stakeholder groups, schools, and the public regarding nonpoint source pollution and best management practices specific to the project.
outreach.indicator: Evaluation forms, pre/post tests, survey responses, event participation
outreach.sourceExcerpt: A positive approach is used to reach the full diversity of people in the community with projects that foster a 'sense of place'... Evaluation forms, pre-test/ post-test, surveys, and reporting of the number of people who attend workshops, trainings and events are among the methods used to measure the success of education/information programs.

outreach.description: At least 3 face-to-face meetings of the Watershed Implementation Team to provide updates, coordinate education events, and review the plan.
outreach.schedule: Minimum of 3 meetings scheduled throughout the project
outreach.sourceExcerpt: As part of the education outreach efforts, the stakeholder group forming the Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek Watershed Implementation Team (WIT) will participate in a minimum of 3 face-to-face meetings.

outreach.description: Field days to showcase implemented BMPs for the public.
outreach.schedule: At least once during project period
outreach.sourceExcerpt: hosting field days to showcase the implemented BMPs for the public

outreach.description: Teacher workshops, Water Model Presentations, Adopt A Stream and mobile classroom events for local educators and students.
outreach.sourceExcerpt: Teacher Workshops – train educators in proximity to the watershed about NPS pollution and provide materials and information...

geographicAreas.sourceExcerpt: The Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek watershed is located in Tate County and covers 35,085 acres.
